summary: The Forest Service is reforming its prescribed fire program. Prescribed fire—or deliberately burning specific areas under managed conditions—is used to mitigate wildfire risk. The agency plans to use prescribed fire more and has been following leading practices to reform its program, but not fully. We found gaps in these areas: Establishing outcome-oriented performance measures Planning to address staffing needs Implementing a reform plan Dedicating staff...
title: Forest Service: Fully Following Leading Practices for Agency Reforms Would Strengthen Prescribed Fire Program
